title: 103_hr4768
content: The Act titled "Veterans' Education and Training Act of 1994" may also be referred to as the "Flight Training" section. The Veterans' Education and Training Act of 1994, also known as the Flight Training section, includes amendments to various sections of title 38 and title 10 of the United States Code related to the Active Duty Program, Post-Vietnam Era, and Reserve Program. Amendments involve redesignating paragraphs and removing specific subparagraphs. The Veterans' Education and Training Act of 1994 includes amendments to title 38 and title 10 of the United States Code, involving redesignating paragraphs and removing specific subparagraphs. SEC. 3. TRAINING AND REHABILITATION FOR VETERANS WITH SERVICE-CONNECTED DISABILITIES. Rehabilitation Resources in title 38, United States Code are amended to include federally recognized Indian tribes. The term 'federally recognized Indian tribe' is defined to include various groups eligible for special programs and services. Allowances in section 3108(c)(2) are also amended. Section 3108(c)(2) of title 38, United States Code is amended to include federally recognized Indian tribes for allowances. A technical correction is made to section 404(b) of the Veterans' Benefits Act of 1992 regarding the application of assistance under chapter 31 of title 38. SEC. 4. ALTERNATIVE TEACHER CERTIFICATION PROGRAMS. Amends Section 3452(c) of title 38, United States Code to include entities providing training for State-approved alternative teacher certification programs. Effective on the date of enactment of this Act. SEC. 5. EDUCATION OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES. SEC. 5 amends section 3476 of title 38, United States Code, regarding education outside the US. Eligible veterans can only enroll in courses at approved institutions of higher learning. Effective date is after the enactment of this Act. The amendment to section 3672 of title 38, United States Code, requires accreditation by a recognized agency for correspondence education programs. Additionally, at least 50 percent of students pursuing such programs must take six months or more to complete them. Amendments to sections 3675(a)(2)(B) and 3680(a) are also made. The amendments made by subsection (a) involve changes to section 3686(c) of title 38, United States Code, removing certain provisions. These amendments will apply to education programs by correspondence and correspondence-residence courses starting 90 days after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 7. State Approving Agencies are amended to increase reimbursement to $13,000,000 for services provided after September 30, 1994. Report to Congress requirement is eliminated, and agency performance evaluation is revised. SEC. 8. Measurement of courses is addressed. SEC. 8. Measurement of courses is amended to include chapter 106 of title 10. SEC. 9. Veterans' Advisory Committee on Education is amended to include chapter 106 of title 10. SEC. 10. Contract educational and vocational counseling. SEC. 10. Contract educational and vocational counseling is amended to increase payment limitation to $6,000,000, effective October 1, 1994. SEC. 11. Service Members Occupational Conversion and Training Act of 1992. Section 4485(d) of the Service Members Occupational Conversion and Training Act of 1992 is amended to remove the restriction on training period length. Section 4486(d)(2) is also amended to require training to be completed in the community. These changes apply to programs beginning after the enactment of this Act. Section 4487 is amended to increase payment limitations. In subsection (b)(3), assistance may be paid to an eligible person's employer for training under multiple job training programs if the employer has not received the maximum assistance amount specified in subparagraph (B). The training period limit has been removed, and training must now be completed in the community. In subsection (b)(3), training assistance can be provided to an eligible person's employer for multiple job training programs until the completion of the 18th month of training or the last approved program, whichever comes first. Section 4488(a) is amended to allow the eligible person to start the job training program with the employer upon notice transmission, with a two-week window for official approval. The House of Representatives passed the bill on August 1, 1994.
